common.privacyFirst: Runs locally in your browser. No tracking. No accounts.

testDataGenerator.title: Test Data Generator - QA Toolbox
testDataGenerator.description: Generate test data locally: emails, phone numbers, UUIDs, names, addresses, and more. No data sent to servers.
testDataGenerator.heading: Test Data Generator
testDataGenerator.subtitle: Test Data Generator is a local tool for generating test data without a backend. Define a data schema, preview generated records, and export them to JSON or CSV for testing, APIs, and development.
testDataGenerator.testDataDescription: Test data generation is the process of creating realistic, structured data for testing purposes. This tool allows you to define a schema with different field types (strings, numbers, dates, emails, etc.) and generate multiple rows of data that match your requirements.
testDataGenerator.fieldName: Field name — key name in the output
testDataGenerator.fieldType: Type — data type (uuid, email, name, phone, address, date, string)
testDataGenerator.fieldRequired: Required — ensures the field is always present
testDataGenerator.fieldManage: Reorder / Duplicate / Remove — manage field structure
testDataGenerator.previewDescription: Displays generated data in table form
testDataGenerator.previewRegenerate: Regenerate creates a new dataset with the same schema
testDataGenerator.exportRows: Rows — number of records to generate
testDataGenerator.exportSeed: Seed — fixed value for reproducible results
testDataGenerator.exportArrayKey: Array key (optional) — wraps output array in an object
testDataGenerator.exportActions: Copy / Download — copy data or download file
testDataGenerator.featureSchema: Define custom schemas with multiple field types
testDataGenerator.featureSeed: Use seeds for reproducible, deterministic data
testDataGenerator.featureExport: Export to JSON or CSV formats
testDataGenerator.featureLocal: All processing happens locally in your browser
testDataGenerator.useCase1: Creating test datasets for API testing
testDataGenerator.useCase2: Generating sample data for database seeding
testDataGenerator.useCase3: Building mock data for frontend development
testDataGenerator.useCase4: Creating test fixtures for automated testing
testDataGenerator.privacyText: All data is generated locally in your browser. No data is sent to any server.
testDataGenerator.confirmReplaceMessage: This will replace your current schema. Continue?

payloadBuilder.title: Payload Builder - QA Toolbox
payloadBuilder.description: Build and break JSON payloads for API testing. Create invalid variants to test validation.
payloadBuilder.heading: Payload Builder + Breaker
payloadBuilder.subtitle: Build JSON payloads visually or in code. Generate invalid variants to test API validation.
payloadBuilder.payloadBuilderDescription: Payload Builder + Breaker is a local tool for creating and intentionally breaking JSON payloads for API testing. Build valid payloads visually or in JSON, then generate invalid variants to test API validation and error handling. All processing happens locally in your browser.
payloadBuilder.templatesDescription: Predefined payloads for common API requests
payloadBuilder.jsonEditorDescription: Edit, format, and minify raw JSON with validation
payloadBuilder.treeBuilderDescription: Visual JSON editor to add, remove, and change fields
payloadBuilder.breakerDescription: Generate invalid payloads (missing fields, wrong types, nulls, edge cases)
payloadBuilder.outputDescription: Preview, compare, copy, or export payloads
payloadBuilder.privacyText: All data is processed locally in your browser. No data is sent to any server.

apiResponseValidator.title: API Response Validator - QA Toolbox
apiResponseValidator.description: API Validator is a developer and QA tool for verifying that JSON payloads match an expected contract defined by JSON Schema. It highlights validation errors, schema issues, and formatting problems to help ensure your API requests and responses are correct before hitting the backend. All checks are performed locally in your browser for faster feedback and better privacy.
apiResponseValidator.heading: API Validator
apiResponseValidator.subtitle: API Validator helps you validate JSON request payloads against JSON Schema directly in your browser.Quickly detect schema mismatches, invalid types, and missing required fields during API development and QA testing
apiResponseValidator.noValidation: Click Validate to check your JSON against the schema
apiResponseValidator.presetsDesc: Predefined schemas and payloads for common API requests
apiResponseValidator.privacyText: All validation happens locally in your browser. No data is sent to any server.
apiResponseValidator.useCase1: Validate API request bodies before sending requests
apiResponseValidator.useCase2: Test backend validation rules during QA
apiResponseValidator.useCase3: Debug schema mismatches and invalid payloads
apiResponseValidator.useCase4: Verify required fields, data types, and formats
apiResponseValidator.whyUse1: Instant feedback for API payload validation
apiResponseValidator.whyUse3: Ideal for developers and QA engineers
apiResponseValidator.workflow1: Paste or write your JSON payload
apiResponseValidator.workflow2: Define or select a JSON Schema
apiResponseValidator.workflow4: Review validation errors or confirm payload is valid
apiResponseValidator.workflow5: Copy the formatted output if needed

statusCodeReference.title: Status Code Reference - QA Toolbox
statusCodeReference.description: Quick reference for HTTP status codes with descriptions and use cases.

userAgentParser.description: Parse User-Agent strings to extract browser, OS, device, and version information locally.

privacy.title: Privacy - QA Toolbox
